intro: Centaurea musakii, commonly known as the Armenian star-thistle, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Armenia and Turkey. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with upright stems and narrow, linear leaves. Its flowers are usually pink to purple, with a distinctive central yellow disk, and it blooms from late spring to early autumn. Centaurea musakii is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to temperate and alpine climates.
